content: baltic beach stole bybeatemieslingerforfancityknits on a vacation at the baltic sea i visited the brick and mortar store of 100farbspiele while browsing the shelves i tried to imagine what the beautiful gradients would look like in a finished project in the end i bought 3 yarns and thus the baltic collection was born the skein from sand to dark blue just asked to be turned into a wavy patterned wrap sizes one ● width 50 cm / 20 in ● length 160 cm / 64 in materials 100farbspiele unikatwolle 4fach 50% cotton 50% acrylic fingering weight - 300 g / 1122 m in colorway ostseestrand ● knitting needles 3 5 mm / us4 ● scissors ● stitch markers ● optional 16 stitch markers ● darning needle ⓒbeatemieslinger 2023 page1/4 baltic beach shawl by beate mieslinger gauge 25 sts x 27 row = 10 cm x 10 cm / 4 in x 4 in in pattern stitch after blocking abbreviations abbreviation explanation st / sts stitch / stitches k knit 1 st p purl 1 st ktbl knit 1 through the back loop yo yarn over p2tog purl 2 sts together sl1wyf slip 1 st with yarn in front of work stitch pattern waves row 1 p2tog 4 times k1 yo 8 times k1 p2tog 4 times - repeat 16 more times 25 sts per repeat row 2 and all even row p all sts row 3 and 5 k all sts ⓒbeatemieslinger 2023 page2/4 baltic beach shawl by beate mieslinger knitted on icord ktbl sl1wyf k work to last 3 sts sl1wyf k sl1wyf work the first and last 3 sts of each row in that way don t pull yarn too tight instructions cast on and setup cast on 427 sts setup row 1 rs ktbl yo k into first st k to end of row - 429 sts setup row 2 ws ktbl yo k into first st p to last 3 sts sl1wyf k1 sl1wyf - 431 sts main part start working in wave pattern optional put in a st marker after each repeat of 25 sts keeping the first and last 3 sts of each row in knitted on icord continue in pattern until about 10 g of yarn are left ending after rs-row bind off purlwise tips & tricks to create a longer or shorter stole the pattern repeat is 25 sts so adding or reducing the st count by 25 will give a different length i was able to work 28 repeats of row 1 of the wave pattern though i couldn t finish the final pattern repeat bind-off was on row 4 when you re getting close to the end of your yarn start weighing the remaining yarn to see how far you re able to continue to be on the safe side start the bind-off when there s about 3 row worth of yarn left over as the bind-off requires more yarn than a standard row ⓒbeatemieslinger 2023 page3/4 baltic beach shawl
